intro: Bidens mossii, commonly known as the Mexican ironweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Mexico and Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers consist of yellow disk florets surrounded by white ray florets. Bidens mossii is known for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
